name: Introduction to Philosophy
description: This course introduces students to the study of philosophy, its major branches, and its primary historical figures.

name: Logic
description: This course covers the basics of symbolic and traditional logic, providing students with an understanding of the principles of valid reasoning.

name: Ethics
description: This course examines the major moral theories, their foundations in philosophical principles, and their implications for life.

name: Metaphysics
description: This course provides an introduction to the central questions and arguments in metaphysics, such as the nature of being, the existence of God, and the problem of evil.

name: Epistemology
description: This course examines the nature of knowledge and its limits, as well as the various theories of knowledge, such as skepticism, foundationalism, and relativism.

name: Philosophy of Language
description: This course explores the relationship between language and meaning, and how language is used to express and comprehend ideas.
